intro: Brachyelytrum silvaticum, commonly known as the woodland rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Its slender, triangular stems are often clustered and bear small, inconspicuous flowers in early summer. Brachyelytrum silvaticum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
